intro: Luehea cymulosa, commonly known as the white soursop or white custard apple, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a small tree or shrub that typically grows to a height of 3–5 meters. The plant produces large, heart-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green in color. Its flowers are white and fragrant, often appearing in clusters at the base of the leaves. The fruit is a rough, spiny berry that contains a white, creamy pulp with a mild, sweet flavor.
